DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identifies other treatments that cannot be defined as surgery, radiation, or systemic therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to an activity or measure that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in patient or population. This is a general term encompassing medical, social, behavioral, environmental and other acts that can have preventive and/or therapeutic impact.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system of numbers (codes) that represent intervention treatments other than surgery, radiation or system therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The puncture of a vein with a needle for the purpose of drawing blood.

Concepts.definition: The collection of blood from a vein, most commonly via needle venipuncture.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure to eradicate or reduce small tumors using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of a thin needle through the skin and into a tumor, which is guided by computed tomography (CT) or ultrasound. Electrical energy delivered through this needle (electrode) heats and destroys the tumor. This therapeutic option is widely utilized by patients that have inoperable cancers, or are unsuitable chemotherapy candidates.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure to kill tissue using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of an electrode into a target tissue. Electrical energy delivered to the electrode heats and destroys the tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (EM-bo-lih-ZAY-shun) The blocking of an artery by a clot or foreign material. Embolization can be done as treatment to block the flow of blood to a tumor.

Concepts.definition: A procedure in which substances are injected into blood vessels adjacent to a tumor for the purpose of interrupting the blood flow to the cancer cells.
The addition of one or more elements and/or chemical compounds that are either absent or deficient in an individual's daily diet.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recommendation; advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Other Alternative Cancer Treatment Not Otherwise Specified

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Other Alternative Cancer Treatment Not Otherwise Specified
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Available in place of something else.: Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Available in place of something else.
Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.
Not characterized in any other way.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Other Experiment Cancer Treatment Not Otherwise Specified

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Other Experiment Cancer Treatment Not Otherwise Specified
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: In the scientific method, an experiment is a set of actions and observations, performed to verify or falsify a hypothesis or research a causal relationship between phenomena. The experiment is a cornerstone of the empirical approach to knowledge. (from Wikipedia): Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data, with the ultimate goal of discovery or hypothesis testing.
Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.
Not characterized in any other way.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recommendation; advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.: Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.: The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The administration of blood or blood products into a blood vessel.

Concepts.definition: The injection of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Acetylsalicylic Acid Or Other Modification or Adjustment Agent

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Acetylsalicylic Acid Or Other Modification or Adjustment Agent
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
An orally administered non-steroidal antiinflammatory agent that inhibits cyclooxygenase synthesis of prostaglandin, preventing the formation of platelet aggregation and inflammation. It has analgesic and antipyretic properties. (NCI04): An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An indication that a change in treatment or a change to a device will be required following an adverse event.
: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An orally administered non-steroidal antiinflammatory agent. Acetylsalicylic acid binds to and acetylates serine residues in cyclooxygenases, resulting in decreased synthesis of prostaglandin, platelet aggregation, and inflammation. This agent exhibits analgesic, antipyretic, and anticoagulant properties.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An indication that a change in treatment or a change to a device will be required following an adverse event.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.: Site; position in relation to the surroundings.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
Site; position in relation to the surroundings.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.: Site; position in relation to the surroundings.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
Site; position in relation to the surroundings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
